FuncDef: The display ethernet uni information command displays information about traffic encapsulation types and behaviors configured on EVC Layer 2 sub-interfaces.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an interface.
-

Specifies the type of an interface.
-

Specifies the number of an interface.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
On a device with multiple EVC Layer 2 sub-interfaces, to view information about traffic encapsulation and behaviors configured on the EVC Layer 2 sub-interfaces, run the display ethernet uni information command. The command output helps verify the configuration and analyze faults.
Prerequisites
The traffic statistics collection mode has been set to multiple for EVC Layer 2 sub-interfaces using the statistic enable mode multiple command in the EVC Layer 2 sub-interface view. Alternatively, a traffic encapsulation type has been configured for EVC Layer 2 sub-interfaces using the encapsulation dot1q command.
Precautions
The traffic encapsulation type and behavior have been configured on a specified EVC Layer 2 sub-interface.
If there are a large number of EVC Layer 2 sub-interfaces on a device, specify interface-type interface-number in the display ethernet uni information command to filter the information.
After the encapsulationqinq vid pe-vid ce-vid default, encapsulation default, or encapsulation untag command is run in the EVC Layer 2 sub-interface view, running the display ethernet uni information command cannot display configurations on the EVC Layer 2 sub-interface.
